isis.stitle: DT 466 / DT 570 / HT 570 Service Manual - 2004 Emissions with EGR - Crankcase, Crankshaft, and Camshaft - Removal - Crankshaft Disassembly

note.para: Before removing the crankshaft, it may be necessary to remove the piston assemblies.

step1.para: Verify that the main bearing caps and crankcase are numbered. You may have to degrease accordingly to gain access to the stamped numbers.
Loosen all the main bearing bolts (M15 x 162).
Lift up both bolts until about half the threads are exposed. Use both bolts to rock main bearing cap free from crankcase.
Discard all of the removed main bearing bolts. These are not reusable due to the permanent stretch they received from "torque-to-yield".
Place an appropriately sized sling around the middle of the crankshaft and attach it to a hoist or crane. Lift crankshaft out of crankcase and place on workbench.
Visually inspect the crankshaft gears for chipping or wear. Replace as required.
Place a chisel between the gear teeth and strike the chisel with a hammer to split the gear.
Remove the oil pump drive first to access the crankshaft gear.
Be careful not to damage the crankshaft during gear removal.

figure.caption: Removing the number seven upper thrust bearing

step1.para: Remove upper main bearing shells by pushing them out of main bearing saddle with your thumbs. Mark the upper shells with bearing number and orientation. Set aside each upper bearing shell with the lower shells until a proper inspection can be done.
